intro: Agathosma punctata, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. Agathosma punctata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in arid environments.
